alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 4:39PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron. * WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cameron Park, Southmost, Downtown Brownsville, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, Gallegos Elementary School, Holly Beach, Vela Middle School, Gonzalez Elementary School, Brownsville Event Center, Perkins Middle School, Brownsville Golf Center, Northside Transfer Station, Brownsville Fire Department Station Six, Hanna High School, Sunrise Mall, B I S D Administration Building, Brownsville Public Library Main Branch, Martin Elementary School and Stell Middle School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
